sentences: Co-Chair Helen Plume (New Zealand) presented text containing the initial activities of the work programme (FCCC/SBSTA/2006/CRP.1).
France, for the EU, supported by CANADA, expressed concern about the chapeau paragraphs.
The US, CANADA and MEXICO stressed that the current mandate of this meeting is to agree on the initial list of activities.
The G-77/CHINA noted the importance of clarifying the content and outcome of the sub-themes in the list of activities.

On the possible establishment of an expert group, she underscored the need for a focal point to facilitate linkages between the various adaptation initiatives and proposed referring instead to a working group.
The EU, AUSTRALIA, CANADA and US entered a reservation on this until the initial list of activities is decided.
Informal consultations will continue on Thursday.
